Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: aldurris
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a junior suite. The bed was large and comfortable, the room was well equipped and the canal views were beautiful. Breakfast was very good, although the queue for the coffee machine caused a bit of congestion. Free wifi and a free computer were a bonus, the staff were helpful and pleasant and the situation is very central for all of Venice's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Going back this summer!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBGS
Reviews.Content: What can I say expect I liked it well enough to go back again this summer. I will also try out 3 new hotels in Venice because I'm using points and I like to experience different areas. My husband and I spent 6 nights at Ca' d'Oro last summer. We requested, and paid extra for a canal view room. Very worth it, in my opinion. Like most Venice hotels the basic rooms are small and the walls are thin. But the staff was all friendly and helpful. The breakfast included cheese and meat slices. I need protein in the morning so this was great for me. You use a coffee machine for your espresso and I was suprised that it is quite decent. There is a rooftop terrace that can be tricky to get to if you're not on the right floor/staircase, but we went up there everyday. One evening we bought bread, meat, cheese, fruit from the nearby COOP opened a bottle of Amarone we bought at a shop near the Rialto and ate up there. Lovely! This hotel is in a quiet location but still near everything. If you want to get to the fish market without fighting crowds at the Rialto just walk 2 minutes to the traghetto at Campo Santa Sofia. (last August this cost 1 euro for 2 people) A super cheap, short gondola ride directly to the fish and fruit market! Also, it takes about 5-7 minutes to walk from the Alilaguna stop on Fondamenta Nuove. It takes longer to get back there since the departing dock is on the other side of a rather large bridge. But, in total, I remember just 3 bridges to cart my luggage over! Not bad for Venice!

Reviews.Title: “1st Trip to Venice, on our 1st Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: mike424u
Reviews.Content: 1st Trip to Venice, having searched many hotel listings, this Hotel seemed to have what we required, location, quality and reasonable price. Good feed back on Web sites. What can we say, itâ€™s a gem, tucked away in a nice quite back street, yet only 5min walk to Rialto Bridge, and 10-15min walk to St Markâ€™s square. Loads of local restaurants to hand, wine shops and small markets. Also just at the end of the road is a main shopping street, with a supermarket, so you can go buy a local, bottle of coke, crisp, snacks, beer, whatever you need. Yes for those that need it, there is also a McDonalds. This hotel is fairly small, but well turned out, decor is good; room size for us was fine. Nice clean modern bathroom. TV if you have time to watch it, ok to catch up on the world news at the end of a long day sightseeing. No kettle, but we always take are own travel kettle for that fist cup of coffee in the mornings. Oh nearly forgot, yes you do get free Wifi, unlike many other hotels near by. Getting to the hotel from the airport was real simple; we could not have planned it better, from Marco Polo airport. Get it wrong and you could spend half a day on a coach, train, then boat then, walk. Private water taxis are very costly, even shared. We Pre booked a return ticket on line with Alilaguna lines web site, 24 Euro. You just walk out of the airport follow the signs to the dock, get on your transfer to Venice, you need to get off on the second stop, F.Te.Nove. From this top its 10 min walk to the Hotel, Warning you do have go over a couple of small bridges, with steps, so you need to be fairly fit if youâ€™re carrying a suitcase. You then just follow the simple instruction we downloaded from the hotel web site, it took us 10min at the most. Real simple to find. Check was straight forward. Continental breakfast. Small area at the rear of the hotel behind the check in. Cheese, ham, croissants, juice, coffee, tea, toast, cakes, cereal, no real issue with any of it and itâ€™s in the room price, unlike many other large more expensive hotels. Another nice find is small roof terrace, it is small, but it gives you one heck of view over the roof tops, and you can sit and have a beer of coffee, you have to supply it yourself. We could not fault the service or the Hotel on our trip, 4 nights. Just remember you do have to pay for the Tourist Tax on check out. The return trip to the airport was also simple; 10min walk down the road over 2 bridges and get on the boat back to the airport. The Airport is fairly small and we returned on a bank holiday, so it was packed out, check in was fine, but there was massive big queue to go through security, so good job we got there in plenty of time as Iâ€™m sure loads missed there flights home due to queues at security. All round a great rip to Venice for our first Wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location”
Reviews.Author: jennmelzer
Reviews.Content: This location was quiet (except in the morning when work 'echoed' through the alleys') and the hotel has easy access by taxi (not vaparetto, but regular taxi, right to the door, which was nice). The only thing was that the 'single' room was really small and the bed was narrow and really hard. Maybe it's just that I am from the USA and our beds usually aren't this hard--I get that, but these seemed particularly hard. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, so overall, besides the really hard beds, nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Lamca274
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice. It was very hard to find though due to the numbering system in Venice which gives the district name followed by the number i.e. it does not give the street name and number. The reception staff were quite helpful even though it took them an entire afternoon to process our passports and they did not offer tours to the Murano glass-blowing factories. There was free Wifi but unfortunately the signal was only limited to the reception area and not the 4th floor where we were staying. The beds were decked in satin red coverings and the rooms were very clean, including the bathrooms. The shower had good water pressure and the toilets flushed well. There was a nice view of the canals and the city from the balcony on the end of the 4th floor corridor. The included buffet breakfast was tasty but lacked a hot food option. The price was very reasonable compared to other places in Venice and it was in a good location, close to San Marco Square, and about 20 minutesâ€™ walk to the train station. Overall the hotel was good and I would recommend it to future travellers. Make sure you work out how the address system works in Venice first as it is easy to get lost within its maze of similar-looking streets and canals!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kellogs1129
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriends for a night. We loved the hotel, the room was exceptionally clean and very nice. We were also pleasantly surprised with a beautiful canal view from our window. The only thing that was somewhat disappointing was the breakfast. It was certainly not bad just limited selection. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: snowwhite01
Reviews.Content: I had a single room with single bed which was an okay size with a very good sized bathroom. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the shower was good although the inside of the shower doors could do with a good scrub with bleach and I also have a thing about toilet seats with cracks. However, everything else was great. The location is brilliant, about 10-15 mins from San Marco and 5 mins from the Ca d'Oro vaporetto stop. Being near a bell tower also gives it a great landmark. The breakfast was fairly typical although I'd had better. The staff were very helpful and I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rgphilli
Reviews.Content: This place is a great place to stay As soon as you get off the airport you can get the blue line waterbus to Fundemonte Nouve. This is the 2nd stop from the blue line from the airport so it was very quick to get to from the airport. Getting off the stop it only took us about 5 minutes to find, which is great considering we were a little tired and hot. They had a room available and we booked a basic double room and had a canal view which looked fantastic. About 10-15 minutes from st marks square but easy to get everywhere and the main thing is that it was in a peaceful area. Breakfast had a great selection of cheeses, cereals, meats, fruit, juices, coffee etc The room was tidy, small but that didnt stop us doing what is needed. Only downside was the air con. It was really cold. Tried to lower it but it didnt work. But other than that a great stay. would stay here again certainly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Frodshamlad
Reviews.Content: For me, this hotel has a perfect location in Cannaregio (my favourite part of the city). Although only a hundred metres north of the Strada Nuova, its location in a charming courtyard is as quiet as you could wish. The hotel itself is very good. We had a deluxe room with a decent canal view, well furnished and a good size. Standard rooms may be much smaller of course. The staff were helpful though unobtrusive. Breakfast is fine, although I wasn't a big fan of the coffee from the machine. We visited in January, a highly recommended time to go to Venice if you wrap up warm, and so the room rate was good value. Overall, I would heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nosilauk
Reviews.Content: We stayed out of season in Ca'Doro so got a good rate :) Our room was a deluxe so quite spacious for the two of us - included a flat screen tv with some satellite channels (BBCW, CNN etc) and a mini bar. The staff were helpful and friendly My only gripe was the lack of wi-fi in rooms makes it hard for business travellers to keep up to date, but no doubt this will improve in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, coveniently located, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Piergiorgio P
Reviews.Content: Our room was the smallest of the hotel, but big enough for two people. It was very clean, had shower and WC, cable TV. Buffet breakfast was ok, with cakes, jam, bread, fruit, biscuits. Coffee, capuccino, chocolate, milk were served by machine. WiFi didn't work in the rooms, but there was a free pc in the hall. Staff was very kind and helpful. In low season the price was very cheap but in high season the hotel can be overpriced. Location was very convenient, 10 minutes walk to Rialto Bridge, 25-30 minutes walk to San Marco Square. The nearest public boat stop (Fondamenta Nove) was just 10 minutes walk. From there San Marco is 45 minutes by boat, Murano 5 minutes, Burano 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding view!”
Reviews.Author: jesstagirl
Reviews.Content: When I booked our room I picked a "canal view" and honestly wasn't expecting much. But when I opened our shutters I literally said "WOW!" and then I tried picking my jaw off the ground. The views we had were wonderful and everything you could ever want from a Venetian view. Our room was also great (we had a junior suite), but we paid 110% more than on any other night (stayed there over NYE). The junior suite, by the way, is comparable in size to a "normal" American room. It was a bit of a walk from the train station, so I'm glad we only brought a backpack with us, and the directions we had got us a little lost, so it took even more time to find the hotel. The actual location is in a great place, and we felt comfortable walking around at night. Breakfast was good: meats, cheese, pastries, cereal, juice, coffee, etc. I would consider staying here again in the future...just at regular room rates!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Eveline025
Reviews.Content: The pictures don't do justice to the hotel. Our room was big and decorated in typical Venetian style. The breakfast was ok and location very good (indeed 5min to Rialto). We were very happy with this hotel, it is clean and the staff is friendly. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: ahottoddie
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a nice little hotel on a quiet back canal in the heart of it all...and that is exactly what we got! What a beautiful place to base your stay in Venice...easy access by vaparetto and well placed for just walking everywhere, which is what we did all three days...a great value and wonderful service...very spacious rooms...and a beautiful little terrace on the roof where every night we took a bottle of wine and my ipod with Andrea Bocelli to enjoy the sunset over Venice's rooftops!

Reviews.Title: “Neat and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dev P
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by helpful staff.the rooms were clean and spacious. Toilets were clean and hygienic. Breakfast was average. Hotel is at a walking distance to St marks square. Also, we given free complimentary water taxi ride to murano and free entry to casino. The only negative was that one has to pay for Internet access in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted!”
Reviews.Author: moonmoth88
Reviews.Content: Delightful, quiet hotel off the main tourist trail but close enough to get to St Marks Square in minutes and easy to find your way back to after a day exploring Venice. We had booked three rooms and two had lovely canal views. This was a nice suprise as we'd thought that only the bigger more expensive suites had canal views. The rooms were small, stylish and v clean. The staff were helpful and friendly on the receiption and spoke good English. We had to pay an extra tax of a couple of Euros each which was a new addition since we booked but this was explained fully. The breakfast was simple in a back room but perfectly ok. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Venice and this is my favourite so far and I'd go back there again. Another bonus to this hotel is a v good resterant just round the corner. A great find as we've had some dreadful over priced food in Venice and this was athentic good quality Italian food, fresh fish and home made pasta. The hotel has a little roof terrace which we made full use of in the evenings, with a night cap, looking out over the canal and roof tops.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: JacquieP
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nites at this hotel and were abit disappointed upon arrival as it did not live up to the internet images. The rooms were of average quality, the hotel staff were pleasant but not great and the breakfast was very average. But it did have a great location just off the Via Cannaregio and a couple of redeeming features like its own canal entrance and roof top viewing deck. We could walk to the Rialto bridge in about 7 minutes. I had been to Venice 25 years ago & was shocked to see the difference. It was extremely busy and I found the streets to be dirty ( rubbish bins overflowing) and pavements shabby and unclean. Unfortunately there is also alot of graffiti on shop fronts and some canal walls ( even on the Rialto bridge).We took a boat out to Murano Island and it reminded me of the Venice I had visited 25yrs earlier. Having said all that it was my husbands first visit and he still thouroughly enjoyed it!! We enjoyed eating at the bacaris ( small bars ) and had a great meal at La cantina ( the platters are amazing)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay and explore La Serenissima”
Reviews.Author: macfab
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time in the Ca d'Oro - and it won't be our last. This Cannaregio hotel is a little off the main "tourist track", therefore a more quiet location, nevertheless very easily reachable by foot, vaporetto, or water taxi. Helpful, friendly staff, even a decent breakfast (which is not the rule in Italy). Try to get one of the rooms at the top floor (more quiet, with direct access to the SPECTACULAR roof terrace). Not the cheapest one, but surely an excellent deal (we've recommended the place to several friends who were also enthused). Don't miss bar "El Sbarlefo" next door!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Jenstar
Reviews.Content: Pros - mostly friendly staff, genuine Italian character and decor, very clean, reasonably priced, very good location - it is in Venice, after all! More than 3 stars really, but not quite 4, so 3Â½. Cons - my single room was incredibly tiny and very dark (not a major problem as I was out most of the time), the wi-fi is not free and is virtually non-existent even after you pay (it sometimes works if you stand at the counter in reception with your laptop) so you have to use the one shared desktop in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room we were in in Italy this time”
Reviews.Author: MissCocoWestbrookCt
Reviews.Content: Two years ago when we requested a standard double room from this hotel, we got a lovely, spacious room with a generous size bathroom. So when we were going back to Venice as one of our stops this time, we decided to stay with a sure thing....or so we thought. We asked for a standard double again. We were given this time a room the size of a shoe box . Two twin beds were against opposite walls with barely enough room to move between them. We could barely find space to put our suitcases in the wardrobe that we had and a hard time opening the wardrobe without the door getting stuck at the end of the bed. The bathroom was minuscule! The bidet had to pull out from the sink! The location of the hotel was very good and convenient. The breakfast was decent. But it was the most expensive of our 4 hotels and the most disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Book it!”
Reviews.Author: l4lx
Reviews.Content: I hemmed and hawed over booking this hotel--people said 'it's off the beaten path', 'quaint', etc., but we couldn't have been happier! Yes, the room was small...you had to put your key into the wall to get electricity...the windows had to be locked to turn on the air conditioning...wi-fi costed $$...the walls are thin (we got in trouble every night for our slumber party-had too much to drink limoncello chats), but even with all that, what a great place!! Located down some side passages (which I could see might be intimidating at night, but really wasn't to us!), and along a 'side canal' (beautiful for photos!) was a lovely hotel that made us feel like we weren't tourists, but guests in the city. It was relatively easy to get to (again, PACK LIGHT!, going over all the bridges and cobbly roads wasn't the easiest even with my roll-y bag, but could have been so much worse)! The city was like tourist-ville, but we felt like we got away from it...not too far away, just minutes away and you're back in it. The terrace on the fourth floor is underutilized and adorable! Great if you wanted to take a load off and chat over a bottle of wine...a great way to see the city above the city! There are a few supermarkets in the area, great to grab a less pricey bottle of water, wine or snack! The breakfast wasn't all that, but if you're American, don't expect to ever see an egg until you return home. Protein is not the staple here, bread is!! Either way we were able to fuel up on yogurt, fresh fruit, bread, nutella...mmmmm... We loved the location and found it easy to get anywhere from here! We took the boat from the airport to Fondamente Nove, then followed the instructions to the hotel on the website (though we got lost, it was ok! You should definitely get lost in this city!!). Went to Murano so easily, to the fabulous market over the bridge, super quick trip to the train station, and the 1 boat (a MUST--save your precious euros on those gondolas and get on this boat--and sit in the front!!! Oh, and I'd buy a pass for however many hours you'll be in Venice, it was an easy way to get around, or hop onto when lost, or hop off when you read the screens incorrectly and got on the wrong boat...don't forget to validate every time). If you are the type that likes the comforts of a hotel, and plans to spend time in it vs seeing the sights, etc. then there are probably better places that have more space, better tv channels, etc. But we absolutely loved this hotel as it fit our needs, and was the perfect jumping off point for all of our Venetian adventures!! Enjoy!! Ooooh and I'd highly recommend Jessica's information on italylogue.com...seriously the best website we found for our Italian Adventure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but”
Reviews.Author: jcisler
Reviews.Content: As most have written the location of this hotel is great - our room had 2 windows that opened over a canel. But the beds and pillows were hard and thin. Our family room had one double bed and 2 twin beds which were cots so I wouldn't call them "beds." The bathroom was updated but our hair dryer had a busted hose and did not work. The hotel is small as are the rooms but thats standard for Venice. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeaWindlesham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to main attractions, yet is tucked away down a little alley so you can escape the crowds. It is situated at the junction of 2 small canals + has it's own attractive watergate at the end of a secluded courtyard. The reception area, lounge, breakfast room + bedrooms are all small but spotlessly clean. Our room was on the 3rd floor (reached by stairs/lift) + overlooked the junction of the 2 canals-stunning view + quite busy at certain times of the day with workman on their boats, providing much entertainment. The room was airconditioned, clean + well furnished, although the fabric lined walls were looking a little tired with water stains in various places + on the ceiling. The main drawback was it's size; so small it required a layby if 2 people were moving around at the same time! The bathroom was also small but clean + perfectly formed with all the usual plus a shower cublcle + hair dryer (very low powered).. Toiletries provided were of the bare minimum: combined shower/hair wash, tissues and a shower cap. No conditioner or body lotion. There is no fridge + there are no coffee/tea making facilities. When we asked at reception if we could get a coffee we had to wait 20 mins. for the machine to be turned on + warmed up; we then had to help ourselves + were charged 2.5 euros for the priveledge. We found breakfast to be a disappointment; buffet style with cereals, tinned fruit salad, a few peices of fresh fruit, poor quality ham+ cheese + stodgy croissants, cake + rolls. Bearing in mind how delicious the pastries are in the nearby patisseries this seemed a shame.Also, coffee was from an automatic machine (self-service) + was very weak - in a country that prides itself on it's great coffee. The reception staff were very friendly + helpful, but one particular member of staff in the breakfast room was most unfriendly + sour faced. She would barge through at all costs even if a guest was carrying hot coffee-very rude. All in all not bad place to stay + by Venice standards fairly reasonably priced, however, for very little more money we have stayed in a far superior place; unfortunately this time they were fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Stone73
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel centrally located (only 5 minutes walk to the Rialto bridge) but sufficiently out of the way so not noisy or too busy at night. Roof terrace on the 4th floor was a beautiful location to start an evening out rooms clean and perfectly adequate. Not luxury but would definitely stay again, all the staff very approachable and very helpful with requested information

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs...”
Reviews.Author: guimonda
Reviews.Content: It was suppose to be the most classy hotel of our italian journey! The hotel clerk seemed bothered by our arrival. The room (very small even for Europe) needed to be refreshed. I woke up with a few bug bites the first morning (but wasn't sure) and I was covered by bug bites the second morning. Told front desk but it did not seem to move them at all.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find”
Reviews.Author: JAGHolidaylover
Reviews.Content: As has been said before, this hotel is a little gem. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. Comments have been made about the breakfast, but we found the selection of cereals, croissants, bread, tea, coffee, juice etc ample. Tinned fruit seemed a little strange to serve when there was also a big bowl of fresh fruit on the buffet. The hotel is in a great area, on the cross of two small canals and really peaceful. It has a good feel as people actually live and work here. There is a Co op supermarket just round the corner which is good to buy water and bits and pieces. Although we didn't have canal view rooms, it didn't matter as we weren't in the rooms that much. The view from the little terrace on the 4th floor was beautiful, with the snow capped Dolomites in the distance. The rooms were small, but well decorated and beautifully clean. The bathrooms were modern and clean, some on the small side, but that's to be expected. We arrived at Fontamente Nove and following the directions on the hotel site, it was really easy to find and took only about 5 minutes. It's also easy to get to from the Ca d'Oro vaporetto stop. The area has several good local restaurants. Tthe best we found was Osteria La Bottega ai Promessi Sposi in Calle dell' Oca, a small alley a couple of minutes from the hotel. Highly recommended, I have done a review in the restautant section. All in all, a great few days in a lovely city and great little hotel that didn't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeoDila
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Ca d'oro, and thought the rate was very reasonable for Venice, where we were anticipating higher prices. This is a very classy little hotel, very conveniently located near the Ca d'oro vaporetto stop. The room was extremely small - the only negative thing we would say about the hotel But altho small, it was very elegant, with first class fixtures and appointments, wonderful bath (tho small), luxurious bed, view of a canal from our window. Staff friendly and helpful, breakfast buffet nice. Comfortable lounge where we spent some time because of the smallness of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quiet retreat from the bustle of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Laney61
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for location and price, and we weren't disappointed. It is only a short walk from the water shuttle (Vaporetto) stop - Ca D'oro. It is also near the Rialto bridge. The rooms were attractive and comfortble with views of the canal or the rooftops of Venice. The staff were helpful, spoke good english and were able to recommend a good restaurant close by. We were there in January, so Venice was relatively quiet, but in high season i could imagine it would be great to come back and relax here as it is tucked away down a small walkway. It has a small courtyard and a water door onto the canal which is a charming feature.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful location, clean and quiet hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: travetz
Reviews.Content: This was a real find, recommended by friends. Utterly peaceful, just off the beaten track but central for Realto, Lagoon and all the sites. You can walk there from the station in 25 minutes. Staff were friendlu and kind, breakfast surprisingly good. Our corner room looked out onto a canal junction. Bliss!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kwalea
Reviews.Content: Once we got used to the different way of travelling and had our map, we were fine. And it was easy to find, using the instructions. Its just that finding your way is not easy in Venice, at all. the hotel was just great. Typical of living in Venice (I iimagine) It had everything we needed and was close the the main canal.

Reviews.Title: “Remember to pack your welly boots”
Reviews.Author: sombochris
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening and the staff were not very welcoming, however the room was clean, the bed was comphy and the heating worked. We had a canal view at no extra cost. During the night a siren went off, I think now it was the flood warning. We were totally marooned the following morning with foot deep water engulfing the footpaths. IT did die down after 2 hours, but we weren't prepared and wasted valuable time. The waitress was consistently grumpy at breakfast . If you are looking for a centrally located reasonably priced place to stay you could do much worse

Reviews.Title: “A Gem at the end of a little street”
Reviews.Author: Rlblack
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here, prior to taking a cruise. The staff was all very helpful. The rooms were nice, bathroom even had a heated towel rack. The hotel had all sizes of rooms, from the double we were in (large king bed), rooms with 2 twin beds- and one very very small room with just a small single bed; The friends we were with, were assigned a handicap room that had both a shower and bathtub/ shower combo- and a huge room. They did have a continental breakfast, it was adequate, but a bit spendy at $10.00 each. We wished we had planned more time in the area. This hotel is located right on a canal, was a quiet area, easy to find- close to a main shopping area. This area of Venice did not have any motorized vehicles on the streets- everyone walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Happy choice”
Reviews.Author: Cruisers1985
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel located away from the mayhem of Venice. The rooms were clean and well maintained. We arrived early in the day, the concierge let us drop our suitcases in one of the rooms. Very accomodating personel. The hotel is also accessible by water taxi, which we took to get to Marco Polo Airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Corner of Venice - Tucked away from the madding crowds”
Reviews.Author: KerryGibson
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, nicely tucked away in a quiet corner. Great staff, beautiful rooms, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet getaway during a busy Venetian summer”
Reviews.Author: The_Hopkinsons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel in early to mid August in 2009. We are both in our mid twenties and have reasonable expectations. FINDING THE HOTEL The hotel was easy to get in the vicinity of if you follow the instructions on the hotel's website. Be warned that the hotel is a door at the end of a fondament, just a few yards along from a restaurant. In fact, the bloke I saw eating his lunch at a table was the hotel manager who had been expecting us. OUR STAY My wife and I stayed there on honeymoon for 3 nights, having also been to Florence and Rome. The manager gave us the keys to the front door and our room and let us come and go as we pleased, which we liked because we wanted to get out and see and enjoy as much of Venice as we could. I tried to speak as much Italian as I could, which was basic to conversational at best. THE HOTEL STAFF The manager brought us breakfast on a trolley each morning at a time we specified, which was a nice touch. We were given a map by the hotel manager and given excellent advice, which is that there is no accurate and comprehensive map of Venice so just use your sense of direction. Venice is full of couples furiously prodding their maps and arguing. My wife had a eye witness travel book of Italy and we used that to get around Venice in conjunction with our map (please note that you will get lost at some point but embrace it, you're on holiday in an amazing place). Regardless of the time of day someone was at the desk. THE ROOM The room was a reasonable size with a blue thick carpet in it, a small tv, a small safe, a clean and nicely done bathroom, and best of all after walking around Venice; a decent bed. The value of the hotel was very good considering we were in Venice and everything is massively overpriced, although our friend is a travel agent and so we got an excellent deal. LOCATION As stated by other tourists on here the hotel is easy to get to the Ca D'Oro waterbus stop (we arrived in Venice by train from the station and got a waterbus fron there), Rialto Bridge, St Mark's Square and the waterbus stop that takes you directly to Marco Polo airport, which was incredibly convenient. There was an Internet cafe along the fondament with a reasonable hourly rate considering the competition in Venice. OVERALL My wife and I enjoyed our stay and didn't see or suffer some of the problems encountered by other tourists who posted their experiences on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Venice, and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: AUXCHATS
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor in fall, 2009, while planning my trip to Venice. I remembered that many older European hotels lack elevators, my goals were: location, price, and the need for easy access to my room. After a long search, I found this hotel online at Trip Advisor. What a treat! The rooms and the location were ideal, the breakfasts truly generous, and the staff were professional. Cannaregio is a part of Venice close to major sights, yet affording quiet and neighborliness when needed. What a find!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Quiet Area with a Flavor of Venice”
Reviews.Author: TVTravelProducer
Reviews.Content: As European hotels go, Hotel Ca D'Oro is a typical three-star European hotel but less charming than the photos on their website indicate. However, it is a good value for the type of hotel that it is though I am far less enthusiastic about it than other reviewers. What I loved about this hotel was it's location in Venice on a canal (one of those things you dream about when you go to Venice) and that it was conveniently located within five minutes walking distance to the Rialto Bridge (without being in the commotion of the Grand Canal). I got up early every morning to walk the neighborhood and experience local life and liked that this hotel was off the beaten path but conveniently located and generally easy to access (if youâ€™re not schlepping luggage). Don't miss a visit to the rooftop of this hotel for fabulous views and photos. Hotel Ca D'Oro has a tiny lobby and small elevator that was very inconvenient for checking in and out as you had to go up to your room one at a time with your luggage (I had a large but not over-sized suitcase and a carry-on and my friend had the same). We had a room that had a view of the canal (if you stuck your head out the window about a foot) and it was located on the alley by the canal. Beware that the locals start unloading boats very early from the canal adjacent to the alley which woke me up every morning around 6:30am (one of the hazards of being near the canal or a busy area). The room was very small but clean (but not very shareable), the bathroom was clean, and the beds were not horrible but not as comfortable as I consistently experience in American hotels. The staff was cordial, but not overly friendly or overly helpful. To be more accurate, it didn't seem to occur to the hotel staff that they were in the hospitality industry. There were no porters and no staff available for hire to assist you with your luggage in any way, which was stressful as we had to schlep our luggage to the water bus terminal about five to six blocks from the hotel (but that included maneuvering over two bridges with staircases). I would have been very happy to pay someone to help us as my friend had disability issues, however the hotel staff could not accommodate any requests of this nature so my advice is to pack light if you're pinching pennies (since water taxis to the airport are close to US$125-150) and it's no fun schlepping suitcases (even on wheels) over two bridges to the water bus station. The breakfast was adequate and very European but I confess, as an American, I was craving eggs and had no success finding an American breakfast offered in the city. Worth a mention: I got several bug bites while in Venice in late October. There were a couple of large mosquitoes in our room that could have been due to the canals. Bring bug spray. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel, but it's fair to know what you're getting. Use the money you save on this hotel for that priceless (but expensive) must do gondola ride. [Tip: Don't book a gondola on the Grand Canal, but book it with a gondolier on one of the small side canals. You'll save about US$30 and get the same ride.]

Reviews.Title: “Clean, old style, friendly staff, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryGirl06
Reviews.Content: This tidy Venice hotel is tucked away in some back streets, but the location is very good, not too far from the Rialto Bridge, quiet at night and amongst residential homes. There is a neat little supermarket just around the corner selling everything you need, and easy to get to restaurants within close proximity. I stayed in a single room, which was VERY small with a very old single bed against the wall, a tiny little bedside table, a window, lcd tv and closet, desk and chair. The bathroom was tiny but new and perfectly adequate, the shower was small but hot water was plentiful and it was comfortable. Although there was a thermostat it was impossible to lower the temperature in the room, which was comfortable, but as a person who prefers it cooler this is annoying. It was quiet at night. The room was very clean, couldn't fault it for that, but the carpet is old and green. I am used to luxury hotels but this was quite comfortable and I would stay there again. Being a single traveller, the rooms are much much much smaller, but they are okay, and the cost saving makes it worth it. Breakfast was included, which was cereal, toast, coffee, pastries, ham or cheese slices (not always enough), plenty of spreads, yoghurt etc. The staff were friendly and helpful, never rude. You can get a water taxi right outside the door, which is very handy when you have luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Typically Venetian and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: geordie_racer2
Reviews.Content: Got back today. I would highly reccomend this hotel. The location is perfect. It's away from the touristy hotels so slightly cheaper but only takes 5mins to walk to the Rialto Bridge and probably 15mins to St Mark's Square. Really quick easy access from the water bus. We got off the bus and walked in a straight line, couldn't have been easier. The rooms were tiny (single) but it's all you need and I do believe this is what you get in Venice. They were spotless and decorated beautifully. Mine was distressed white furniture and my Mum's was dark wood with a mini single sleigh bed. Breakfast was simple - rolls, cheese, ham, fruit juice and coffee - exactly what you would expect from any Italian hotel. The staff were very helpfull and polite. I will definitely be staying here again. I could not fault it in any way at all. Just don't expect big rooms, you won't get them in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fontanafratta1
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel in mid September. The hotel is beautiful. Just off the main road which for a busy tourist city like Venice it's a blessing. First of all our accomodations were sent to the hotel wrong by Hotwire, I booked for 1 adult and 1 child (under 18), but the hotel received reservations for a single. Needless to say my panic when I got there at 11pm and the hotel was fully booked. The staff went out of their way to help us out (because after all it was not their fault), they gave us a little cot and we squeezed in to the best we would. Because of the understanding of the staff and their helpfullness I will definately go back and make a point of staying there. The hotel itself is lovely. Very Venician it has it's own little courtyard with a well in the middle very beautiful. The room was very clean and nicely furnished. Highly recomment this hotel. Hint: Most people find it hard to locate this hotel, the easiest way to find it is to take the Vaporetto (waterbus) to Ca'Doro stop, once you make your way from the walkway to the main street, take a right and keep walking until you get to a little piazza (there is a well and a Kebab restaurant) and benches to sit), make a left and the hotel is at the end of the street. In total the walking time is about 5-8 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: randajam
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed myself very much at this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. The breakfast was good. The room was very clean and spacious. I couldn't ask for anything more. They also have their own taxi that'll pick you up from train station. Great hotel, will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Faulty towers”
Reviews.Author: HappycatTulsa
Reviews.Content: When we stayed there we paid extra for a canal view and the canal was being dredged with pumps running day and night. We slept with the shutters closed to eliminate some of the noise, and couldn't get the air-conditioner to work. Teh hotel desk informed us we didn't have the shutter closed properly, but never offfered assistance. My son & daughter-in-law were staying elsewhere and showed us their (mush larger and less expensive) room, so we offered to show them ours--much to the distress of the desk who protested who worried about the pollce! When we ordered coffee in the dining area, my husbanc e eventually got his--I never did. Room service took an hour for coffee. Upon depature 2 employees at the desk watch us discuss and fill out Travellers checks (in euros), and then informed us "we don't take these." the manager eventually did for a 5% fee. Thsi was the only place i stayed in Italy that iIwould not go back to--also the only one that kept our passports rather than making copies. Oh--but the location was fairly good.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: FatClone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very reasonably priced, yet clean and with helpful and friendly staff. We had some difficulty finding it (but that's true of most hotels in Venice). Breakfast buffet is basic but perfectly acceptable and the coffee is very good. Nice and quiet at night. Only a short walk to a busy shopping area and a selection of cafes, restaurants, etc. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and charming hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ravnholt
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in the north part of venice on the main island, A litte away from the "turist motorways" which we like the most. The room very clean and we staff were very friendly. The prices for dinks and internet are very faire. This is a good spot if you want to exploring the local sites and places to eat nearby. Not very turisted, lots of the local wroking people seems to eat at a pizzria earby, which only had local people and a few turists eating there. Concidering the price we paid and the service we got we would definitely reccomend this hotel to anyone. Stine & Anders Danmark

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: quinsana
Reviews.Content: Considering the price, I wasn't expecting luxury, but the room was hideous, tiny, and it stank. The manager was incredibly rude.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, But Adequate”
Reviews.Author: FastTrackDxB
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in June 2008. Booked it thru Expedia. Our stay was adequate, the hotel is clean, very basic, and sort of small. The room they showed us when we arrived was very small, they changed it despite the fact that it was peak season. The location is really wonderful, close to just about everything. Breakfast was ok, we ate there every mornng for 7 euros/person. I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel for honeymooners or for a romantic getaway. There're no great views and hotel isn't facing any of the main streets. For our purposes, it was just fine and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place”
Reviews.Author: erandgr
Reviews.Content: What a great place with a friendly staff always ready to help; Great continental breakfast. Little hard to find at first. Take the corner room on canal side.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading - Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: jemsmullen
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I asked if I could have a queen bed rather than two single beds pushed together. The hotel accepted my reservation with this request. We also asked for a room with a canel view, this cost me an extra 15 euros a night. When we got to the hotel it was in a good location and easy to find and get to from the boat stop. The room we got was a lot smaller than we were expecting and it had two beds pushed together. The canel view looked directly at a building opposite the hotel, which was about 20 feet from the window, basically the view was of a wall. When I explained to the hotel manager what I had requested he was very unhelpful even though he could clearly see my request for the queen bed. The answer I got was he could not help me and when we were leaving we did not even get a good bye or asked how was our stay, again this was the hotel manager. Venice is a lovely city and well worth a vist but I would give this hotel a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay -excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Raggen
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I have just arrived home after a wonderful holiday in Italy. We actually first started off our holiday in Gdansk in Poland, but the sun and warm weather unfortunately did not appear so we ended up in Rimini in Italy. To end our holiday and to get the easiest flight back home, we decided to go to Venice and booked a one night stay at CaÂ´DÂ´Oro. We found it to be an excellent choice! Great location as it was in a very quiet area but still easy to reach all attractions, very helpful & friendly staff, nice and clean hotel. We had paid the extra 15Euros for canal view, which my fiancÃ© found to be good value as he had good entertainment sitting in the window watching the guys working with the drainage in the canal below. (The canal outside was opened again the day after). The canal view is the typical view in Venice, so I donÂ´t understand others somewhat negative opinion in this matter.. Probably unrealistic expectations. But this is the typical Venetian window view, so if you donÂ´t have the highest or unrealistic expectations you wonÂ´t be disappointed. We stayed in room 103, great room size (as mentioned, depends on expectation), comfortable double bed, very nice and high standard bathroom. It has also refrigerator and safe. We didnÂ´t quite figure out the aircon, how the temperature worked as the display was not logic, but it didnÂ´t work at all if the windows werenÂ´t properly closed. We thougth the windows were closed (which by the way is a bit hassel to get closed) but after calling the reception they could see in their system that our window wasnÂ´t closed. (This hotel is a bit high-tech and has the best security systems IÂ´ve ever seen in this price-range) . The aircon was quite cold so we only had it on for maybe 5-10 minutes before we went to bed and then turned it off. Worked just fine. The room did not get warm afterwards, even in the morning it stayed cool. On top of the roof thereÂ´s a small balcony where you have a nice view and can sit and enjoy your espresso in the morning or evening. The breakfast buffet is served until 1030 a.m. and we found it to be very good! The average Italian breakfast consists of cakes only(!) so here we could enjoy croissantes and a more "continental" breakfast, so we were very pleased with the selection offered. We did take advantage of the hotels offer on free motorboat ride to the Murano island to the Murano glass factory. We asked in the reception when it could be possible to go there, and 5 minutes after we were picked up by the boat just outside the hotel. At the Murano glass factory I just have to emphasise that you should be very aware that the people working there and taking care of you the minute you arrive is in fact sellers for the factory! That means that the minute you start to show interest for something the person will follow you everywhere and try to make a "special price for you", and "our man" tried every trick he could think of to get us to buy the things we had looked at. This was really annoying!! There are the most beautiful things made of glass you can imagine, but the prices are way off the roof! So be very careful or else you could end up buying something you really cannot afford. We did buy some very small stuff, like corks made with glass to put on your bottle of wine after itÂ´s opened, it costed 15 Euro each. Afterwards we found the same thing in an other shop in Venice for the price of 5 Euro! So our advice is: DO NOT SHOW MUCH INTEREST ON WHAT YOU SEE THERE AND DONÂ´T BUY ANYTHING THERE!!! YouÂ´ll probably find it cheaper other places.. OR: Look in shops (theyÂ´re selling Murano glass everywhere in Venice) and if you see anything you really want to buy, then go to Murano glass factory and compare the prices.. Then youÂ´ll at least know if youÂ´ll get ripped off or not). Other than this, loved the stay in Venice and loved the stay at CaÂ´DÂ´Oro!! Will definately recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “The Ca D'oro”
Reviews.Author: jet_setter1990
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in the Ca D'oro in the Superior Deluxe Double Room. Room 202, room with the canal view which we requested when booking. The canal which we were overlooking wasnt as exciting and romantic as it sounds. Directly opposite are residential houses where the locals are living. Not really worth the extra 15 euros per night. Breakfast is included in the room rate and it was very nice but there is no variety and there was the same on offer each morning. Croissants, cheese, hams, cornflakes and muesli. Juice and Coffees are available for drinks. The airconditioning was very welcoming during the day but was not able to be controlled within the room. At night the air con couldnt be fully turned off and got wquite cold late at night. Several times i woke up next morning freezing. In the room description of the Superior Deluxe Double Room the bathroom stated to include a bath and a shower, however when we got there, we found just a shower. I didnt complain as I prefer showers but should be noted if a bath is requested. The cleaners came around everyday which was very good. The only problem we had with them was that they just came straight in. We were having an afternoon nap and even put the "do not disturb" sign on the door, and they still came in. Be warned that cleaners come around at about 1pm everyday and will come in, no matter what. Many times the cleaners also didnt make the bed properly. the location of the hotel however is very good. After arriving at the airport, take the Alilaguna, blu line to fondamente nuove. the ticket will cost 12 euros each but is the cheapest way for getting to venice. a water taxi will cost around 95 euros. From there head right and take the first left. Follow this over two bridges. There is a very handy co-op shop on the right had side which is very reasonably priced. I would definitley recommend buying drinks from there rather than the mini bar in the room. As you walk down that street there is a very nice restaurant with very good service. It is also very reasonably priced and very high quality food. After the co-op turn immediately right and the hotel is at the end of that street on the right. There is a small sign, but is easily missed. It takes around 5 minutes to find the hotel from the fondamente nuove alilaguna stop. If you have never been to venice before, do note that most resaurants have a cover charge of around 2,50 euro and have a service charge of 12%. However this is most often welcomed due to the excellent service and food. I would definitley recommend the lasagne to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would be wonderful any other time...”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous707
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel would be wonderful any other time, except, of course, the time when we stayed there. We booked (and paid) in advance and showed up to find the otherwise cozy, quaint hotel doused in stench and with blighted views. Unknown to us, the adjacent canal was undergoing dredging during our stay. Instead of a cute Venetian canal, there were dredging machinery, dams, plywood, fencing and mud, which smelled so awful I had to cover my nose and mouth while walking up to and away from the lobby. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the room we ended up staying in (we asked to be moved to a room further away from the stench) was comfortable. However, had we known there would be dredging of the canal and the resulting smells and horrible views, we would have gladly stayed elsewhere. If you are considering booking a room there this summer, I highly suggest you contact the hotel in advance and ask when/if the dredging is finished and the canal put back in order.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: candym
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in Sept. 06' and loved it. Claudia at the front desk was amazing. She was so sweet. My husband emailed her before we arrived to have her make us reservations at a romantic restaurant. It was a secret because he wanted to ask me to marry him! She even had a bottle of Champaign in our room for when we returned. :) The room was beautiful and we had a great view over the canal. The hotel was also well located, close to a boat stop. Thank you Hotel Ca'd'Oro for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Venicelover72
Reviews.Content: Hi there, I have just returned from a 4-day break in Venice with my partner, staying at the Hotel Ca D'oro and wanted to share our thoughts with future visitors. As other reports testify, it IS difficult to find so here are our tips - On arriving at Fondamente Nove (Aliguna Blue line from the airport), turn immediately down the street to the left and walk past the Gesuiti Church on your left. Walk straight ahead through the square over 2 small bridges past a restaurant on your left. Continue straight ahead past the Co-op mini supermarket. After the shop take your first right and walk past Pizzeria La Perla on your left. The hotel Ca d'oro is at the end of this lane on your right - in the corner opposite the Gentlemen's clothes shop. - this sounds a bit of a trek but it a 10 minute walk at most. The Hotel has a fantastic location - highly recommend eating at Trattoria Casa Mia just seconds away from the hotel - turn right at the small estate agent and can highly recommend the roof terrace for a lazy early evening drink as the sun sets...just lovely! The room was spacious and clean and breakfast was great..one word of warning though...stock up on soft drinks, wine etc. at the Co-op as the description of 'bar' in the hotel is actually just the receptionist or night porter getting a couple of cans from a fridge in the kitchen and it's so much better (and much much cheaper) to be prepared by getting supplies in yourself.. Can recommend highly although at times, a couple of reception staff could have been a little friendlier...a minor snag Overall, a lovely break

Reviews.Title: “Great find it atmospheric Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: wonderlanded
Reviews.Content: We arrived rather exhausted at Ca' d'Oro after a hectic two week trip around the Balkans, and were delighted with it. Large bathroom with an excellent bath, comfortable beds, and a good breakfast for an Italian hotel of this type -- much better than some I've experienced in the past. The staff were helpful and friendly throughout our three-day stay, the room was kept impeccably clean, and frankly the location can't be beaten in Venice -- a little off the tourist trail but still only a ten-minute stroll to the Rialto Bridge, but with the added benefit of local restaurants, shops and markets that aren't catering to great hordes of tourists. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dave05
Reviews.Content: Great service, central location. Small rooms with tiny tiny bathroom. Good breakfast and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beware reservation policy/efficiency”
Reviews.Author: ddharper
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at this hotel. We booked thru their website but after reading some of the accounts of poor service, etc., in TripAdvisor we cancelled the booking on March 28 for a September stay (and booked the Ca' Angeli instead which was wonderful) . The cancellation was confirmed by their agent, [--], (Giocomo Vizzotto). We returned from Venice this week and received an email saying we were charged E220 as a no show. When I answered attaching their cancellation msg Giocomo apologized and said he would return the funds to my bank account. Since that would entail fees and problems I asked that the hotel just credit the amount back to my credit card. This they (Alice - hotel reception) refused to do and said that it was best-bookings mistake and therefore best-bookings must handle. From reading other accounts of front desk surliness I would suggest that anyone thinking about a holiday in Venice avoid these people and stay somewhere else. David Harper Bainbridge Island, WA

Reviews.Title: “Best roofdeck”
Reviews.Author: Marypak
Reviews.Content: We had 6 people in our group, 2 teens, 1 kid, 1 granny. Really great location, close to water taxi stop Ca'D'Oro. Had no trouble finding it, just follow the signs slowly. Some really cute restaurants are steps away along with the canals, shopping. The breakfast was good, pastry, meat, cheese, fruit, lots of varitety to please the kids and grownups. We liked the cappuccino and the cool coffee machine at breakfast. The rooftop deck is on the fourth floor, it has a beautiful view. it's really great if you're up there when all the bells are ringing and you can take some wine up there in the evening. The bathrooms are new and nice. The air conditioning works great. The people who work there are really friendly, especially the people late at night. They even made us cappucino one night. They have good suggestions of things to do and spoke ok english. We stayed in about 7 different places this trip and this was our favorite. It has a painfully slow elevator. Best coffee on the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Lorimaui
Reviews.Content: Though I only stayed one night, I thought this hotel was great! Nicely located for easy walking distance to attractions, the water taxi and boat to Marco Polo airport. The staff was friendly and helpful with my many questions, as I was traveling alone and this was my first trip to Venice. Breakfast was simple but fine - room was clean and comfortable. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Golden Experience at the Ca'D'Oro”
Reviews.Author: burnley43
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary.I had read reviews about it ( mostly good,some bad and some downright awful). I was kind of wary as all our previous holidays have been beach holidays booked through travel agents, but I need not have worried as this hotel is just fantastic!! We arrived in the evening and were greeted warmly by the young lady on reception who welcomed us and handed us our key. On entering the room we were pleasantly surprised to say the least. I had booked a junior suite- room 205.What a gorgeous room with fabric on the walls instead of wallpaper,lovely beamed ceiling with Murano chandelier,huge bed ,mini bar and in the bathroom a jacuzzi bath as well as shower.The bedroom windows overlook two small canals and even though there was work being done on one of them at the time of our stay this did not detract from their beauty. Take the lift to the 4th floor and you come across another treasure - the roof terrace - just the place to sit and sip a glass or two of wine on a warm evening and marvel at the views across the Venetian rooftops. The hotel is well placed to reach all the sights within 10-15 minutes and there are some lovely places to eat not too far away. Breakfast is taken in the small breakfast room next to reception. There is a good selection of cereals,croissants,bread rolls,ham,cheese and yoghurts. Coffee is from a machine but the coffee with milk is deliciously creamy and frothy!!!!! During our stay we wanted to make the most of the sights and so decided to book a couple of walking tours. My husband asked at reception and the tours were booked for us without problem.All in all I woud not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, the staff are friendly and helpful, the hotel is an absolute gem and Venice..... What can I say ? Go ahead and book.You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - reservation or not?”
Reviews.Author: travels007
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed reservation through their booking agency and they refused two weeks in advance to adjust the arrival date and cancelled the whole reservation leaving us scrambling for a hotel. Not accommodating at all.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kendevos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Venice for 12 days in November 2006. This hotel was wonderful. The location is great, near everything important, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but well appointed. Nearby restaurants had great food. We hated to leave. Venice was the best.

Reviews.Title: “alright but!!!!”
Reviews.Author: donnie134
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel throught their own website asa present for my girlfriends 30th birthday. Have read previous reviews and I was not that impressed to be honest. Arrived on a Thursday late on by water taxi, lovely if expensive way to arrive in Venice. The hotel itself,Staff where reasonably helpful but not overly.The room was adequate just interesting view of the wall,Quite noisy at times as well with occassional arguing by locals. However the one disappointment to the whole trip was on the morning of checkout.We checked out at 0700 in the morning.During checkout we asked if we could get a cup of coffee from the breakfast room.And met downright refusal to be allowed 2 cups of coffee.We again asked and again met refusal. We paid for 4 nights bed and breakfast but received three.Afetr paying approx 720 euros for 4 nights. To be honest the arrogance and sheer bull-headness of the staff to give us a measly cup of coffee,Will mean I will not be staying here again or recommending it to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: KJanski
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights of our honeymoon at the Ca' D'oro and absolutely loved it! We stayed in Aug. 06 during a time where they were repainting the second floor rooms. Our room was booked on the second floor. My wife was 5 months pregnant and could not stay on the floor due to the smell of the paint fumes. After explaining our situation, the staff (Alice) went out of her way to accomodate by giving us the junior suite on the third to stay in at no extra cost! The hotel is walkable from the train station (about 20 minutes), but the water taxi also has a stop close by. The included morning breakfast was fantastic! Be wary of the free trip to Murano as the hotel does not return you. Just grab the public water taxi for the trip home. The room was very clean and the service outstanding. I would highly recommend the Ca' D'Doro.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SimranK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights and absolutely loved it. It was better than I had expected and the location was great. It's located in the quiet residential Canneregio district but it's a short walk to Rialto and San Marco. The staff were very very helpful, breakfast was included and was what you'd expect of a continental breakfast. The room was immaculate. And even though, I didn't have a canal view, being on the top floor, I had easy access to the roof terrace. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a WONDERFUL lovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel. It is on a quiet street near the Rialto and not far from San Marco but in a neighborhood that has real Venetions. They were very nice at the reception. My room was tiny (a single room) but that is standard in Venice with buildings that are hundreds of years old (there are many prohibitions on altering the buildings). VERY clean which is important to me. Great restaurant a minute away and many many others nearby. Location is fantastic and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Carnevale in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean well situated away from the hassles of the main tourist attractions of Venice, and was a great place to chill out after the Carnevale. The staff booked our opera, concerts and dinner reservations via email before we arrived and paid for them in advance for us. The staff were really helpful making this stay as comfortable as possible and ensured that we enjoyed the Venice Carnevale in great style. Claudia in reception was particularly helpfull during our stay. Highly recommended for a short stay in a small warm family run hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ca' d'Oro
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 4604, 30131 Venice, Italy
